title: Define Transformation Engine Service Interface
description: Analyze requirements for the transformation engine and define the C# interface `ITransformationEngine` that will be implemented by the Jint wrapper.
sprint_goal: Establish Backend Foundations for Data Transformation & Extensibility
acceptance_criteria: An `ITransformationEngine.cs` file is created with a method signature like `Task<JsonNode> ExecuteAsync(...)`. Interface is documented. Peer-reviewed.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed and approved. Interface is part of the shared contracts library.
deployment_notes: Part of the core application library.
business_value: Establishes the contract for all transformation operations.

title: Implement Jint Engine Wrapper and Sandboxing
description: Create the `JintTransformationEngine` class that implements `ITransformationEngine` and configures its security constraints (CLR access, timeout, memory, statement count).
sprint_goal: Establish Backend Foundations for Data Transformation & Extensibility
acceptance_criteria: The class correctly instantiates and configures a `Jint.Engine` with `AllowClr(false)` and configurable limits. A unit test attempting to access the file system throws a SecurityException.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed with security focus; Unit tests for sandbox configuration passing.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for each security constraint.
business_value: Provides the secure execution environment for user scripts.

title: Implement .NET-to-JS Data Marshalling with JsonNode
description: Implement logic to convert a `System.Text.Json.JsonNode` to a JS object for Jint, execute the script, and parse the result back into a `JsonNode`.
sprint_goal: Establish Backend Foundations for Data Transformation & Extensibility
acceptance_criteria: The `ExecuteAsync` method accepts and returns a `JsonNode`. Unit test passing a nested JSON object and verifying a modified property is successful.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for data marshalling are passing.
business_value: Enables data exchange between the .NET host and the JS sandbox.

title: Design and Define IConnector Interface
description: Define the public C# interface `IConnector` that all plug-ins must implement, including methods for schema definition, connection testing, and data fetching.
sprint_goal: Establish Backend Foundations for Data Transformation & Extensibility
acceptance_criteria: `IConnector.cs` is created with documented methods. A separate `Connector.Contract.csproj` is created for the distributable assembly.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; contract assembly builds successfully.
deployment_notes: This contract will be part of the public PDK.
business_value: Defines the foundational contract for the entire plug-in architecture.

title: Implement Plug-in Loader Service with AssemblyLoadContext
description: Create a backend service that scans the 'plugins' directory, loads each DLL into an isolated `AssemblyLoadContext`, and registers any types that implement `IConnector`.
sprint_goal: Establish Backend Foundations for Data Transformation & Extensibility
acceptance_criteria: Service correctly loads valid connectors and logs errors for invalid ones. Integration test verifies isolation of conflicting dependencies.
definition_of_done: Integration tests with sample 'good' and 'bad' plug-ins pass. Code reviewed for memory leak and security risks.
testing_requirements: Integration testing with multiple plugin scenarios.
deployment_notes: Requires a 'plugins' directory in the application root.
business_value: Provides the dynamic loading capability for third-party extensions.

title: Design and Implement Relational Schema for Core Entities
description: Create EF Core entities for User, Role, Script, Version, Report, etc., and generate the initial database migration.
sprint_goal: Establish Backend Foundations for Data Transformation & Extensibility
acceptance_criteria: C# entity classes created. `ApplicationDbContext` is configured. EF Core migration is generated and successfully applied.
definition_of_done: Migration successfully applied to a test database. Code reviewed.
deployment_notes: This is the initial schema for the relational database.
business_value: Creates the persistence layer for all core application entities.

title: DB Design: Create Schema for Scripts and Versions
description: Define the EF Core entities `TransformationScript` and `TransformationScriptVersion` and generate the database migration.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: EF Core entities are defined. A migration file is generated and applies/reverts successfully.
definition_of_done: Successful application of migration. Code reviewed.
business_value: Provides the data structure for versioning transformation scripts.

title: Implement MongoDB Repository for Audit Logs
description: Design the document schema for `AuditLog` and `SecurityViolationLog` and implement a C# repository layer using the MongoDB .NET driver.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: POCOs for log documents are created. `IAuditRepository` and its MongoDB implementation are created. Repository can write logs to a MongoDB instance.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for the repository pass. Code reviewed.
testing_requirements: Integration testing against a test MongoDB.
deployment_notes: Requires MongoDB connection string in configuration.
business_value: Implements the persistence layer for the immutable audit trail.

title: Implement Exception Handling for Sandbox Violations
description: Enhance the Jint wrapper to catch specific exceptions for timeout, memory, and statement count violations and log them to the security audit trail.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: `try-catch` block correctly catches Jint exceptions. A violation event is logged for each exception type. The caught exception is wrapped and re-thrown.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for each violation scenario are passing.
business_value: Ensures security violations are properly logged for compliance.

title: Implement Script Encryption Service for Data at Rest
description: Create a service to encrypt/decrypt script content using .NET Data Protection APIs to ensure script content is never stored in plaintext.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: `IScriptEncryptionService` is defined. Implementation uses `IDataProtector`. Unit test confirms successful encrypt/decrypt roundtrip.
definition_of_done: Automated tests pass; Code reviewed for security.
deployment_notes: Requires DPAPI key configuration in the production environment.
business_value: Implements critical data-at-rest security requirement.

title: API: Implement Script Creation Endpoint (POST)
description: Implement the `POST /api/v1/transformations` endpoint to create a new `TransformationScript` and its initial `TransformationScriptVersion`.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: Valid POST returns 201. New script and version are created. Content is encrypted. Duplicate name returns 409.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for the POST endpoint pass.
business_value: Provides the API for creating new transformation scripts.

title: API: Implement Script Update and Versioning (PUT)
description: Implement the `PUT /api/v1/transformations/{id}` endpoint. This will create a new version and update the parent script's active version pointer.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: Valid PUT returns 200 OK. A new version record is created. The parent script's `ActiveVersionId` is updated. The operation is atomic.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for the PUT endpoint, including transaction validation, pass.
business_value: Enables the core versioning workflow for scripts.

title: Implement RBAC and Auditing for Script Management API
description: Secure all CUD endpoints with Administrator role-based access control and implement audit logging for all CUD operations.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: API requests from non-admin users are rejected with 403. Successful CUD operations result in a new record in the audit log.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for authorization and audit log creation pass.
business_value: Secures the script management API and provides a compliance audit trail.

title: Backend: Implement Script Preview API Endpoint
description: Create the `POST /api/v1/transformations/preview` endpoint. It will accept script content and sample data, execute the script, and enforce a server-side timeout.
sprint_goal: Build Script Management API and Audit Infrastructure
acceptance_criteria: A valid POST returns 200 OK. Endpoint enforces a configurable server-side timeout. A request that times out returns an error.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for the preview endpoint, including the timeout scenario, pass.
business_value: Provides the backend service for the real-time script preview feature.

title: Frontend: Implement Script List Page
description: Create a React page that displays a list of all transformation scripts fetched from the API, with buttons to create and edit.
sprint_goal: Develop Script Editor UI and System Observability
acceptance_criteria: Page fetches and displays scripts from the API. 'Create' and 'Edit' buttons navigate to the correct routes.
definition_of_done: E2E tests pass for navigation and data display.
business_value: Provides the main entry point for managing transformation scripts.

title: Frontend: Integrate Monaco Editor Component
description: Integrate the Monaco Editor into the script editor page, configured for JavaScript with syntax highlighting and real-time validation.
sprint_goal: Develop Script Editor UI and System Observability
acceptance_criteria: Monaco Editor renders on the page with JS syntax highlighting. Invalid syntax is visually flagged. Editor content is managed by React state.
definition_of_done: Component tests and manual verification complete.
business_value: Provides a rich, professional editing experience for administrators.

title: Frontend: Implement Three-Pane Resizable Layout
description: Implement the three-pane UI for the script editor, sample data, and output, with resizable dividers.
sprint_goal: Develop Script Editor UI and System Observability
acceptance_criteria: UI displays three distinct panes. Dragging dividers resizes them.
definition_of_done: Manual testing and E2E tests for layout are complete.
business_value: Provides the core layout for the script development and testing workflow.

title: Frontend: Implement Preview Logic and Output Display
description: Wire up the 'Preview' button to call the backend API, manage loading state, and render the successful JSON output or structured error message.
sprint_goal: Develop Script Editor UI and System Observability
acceptance_criteria: Clicking 'Preview' sends data to API. Loading spinner is shown. Successful JSON output is pretty-printed. API error is displayed in a user-friendly format.
definition_of_done: E2E tests for success, script error, and timeout scenarios pass.
business_value: Connects the user interface to the live preview functionality.

title: Implement Prometheus /metrics Endpoint
description: Configure the .NET backend to expose a `/metrics` endpoint with custom metrics for script execution time, total executions, and constraint violations.
sprint_goal: Develop Script Editor UI and System Observability
acceptance_criteria: GET `/metrics` returns data in Prometheus format. Response includes custom histogram and counter metrics. Metrics are correctly incremented.
definition_of_done: Integration test verifies the endpoint and metric values.
deployment_notes: Requires monitoring system to be configured to scrape this endpoint.
business_value: Enables proactive monitoring and alerting for the transformation engine.

title: Create Performance Benchmark Test
description: Develop an automated integration test to execute the transformation engine against a 10MB JSON dataset with a 200-statement script and assert completion under 10 seconds.
sprint_goal: Finalize Operational Readiness, Documentation, and Quality
acceptance_criteria: Test class is created using ~10MB JSON and ~200 statement JS files. Test fails if execution exceeds 10 seconds on CI server.
definition_of_done: The performance test is integrated into the CI pipeline and passes reliably.
testing_requirements: Integration testing on a standardized environment.
business_value: Validates that the core engine meets its non-functional performance requirements.

title: Create Documentation and Examples for PDK
description: Create the Plug-in Development Kit (PDK) deliverable, including technical documentation for the IConnector interface and two working example projects (e.g., FHIR and HL7).
sprint_goal: Finalize Operational Readiness, Documentation, and Quality
acceptance_criteria: Markdown documentation for `IConnector` is created. Sample FHIR and HL7 connector projects are created and build successfully. PDK is packaged as a ZIP archive.
definition_of_done: A developer can successfully build and run the example projects by following the documentation.
deployment_notes: PDK will be a downloadable artifact.
business_value: Enables third-party developers to extend the system, a key strategic goal.

title: Document and Test Backup/Recovery Procedures
description: Create and validate documentation for backing up and recovering the application's relational and document databases, ensuring compliance with RPO/RTO.
sprint_goal: Finalize Operational Readiness, Documentation, and Quality
acceptance_criteria: `BackupAndRecovery.md` document is created. A disaster recovery test is performed and documented, proving data can be restored within the 4-hour RTO.
definition_of_done: Successful execution of the documented DR test by a team member unfamiliar with the process.
business_value: Provides customers with the necessary procedures for business continuity.
